ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Implementation of Tyler, Critchley, Duembgen and Oja's (JRSS B, 2009, <doi:10.1111/j.1467-9868.2009.00706.x>) and Oja, Sirkia and Eriksson's (AJS, 2006, <http://www.ajs.or.at/index.php/ajs/article/view/vol35,%20no2%263%20-%207>) method of two different scatter matrices to obtain an invariant coordinate system or independent components, depending on the underlying assumptions.

Implementation of Tyler, Critchley, Duembgen and Oja's (JRSS B, 2009, <doi:10.1111/j.1467-9868.2009.00706.x>) and Oja, Sirkia and Eriksson's (AJS, 2006, <http://www.ajs.or.at/index.php/ajs/article/view/vol35,%20no2%263%20-%207>) method of two different scatter matrices to obtain an invariant coordinate system or independent components, depending on the underlying assumptions.

name: r-ics
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.4-2" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-ics
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/ICS_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/ICS/ICS_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 0233531f88dfb641e21f81458986b22477fca2a950be0e0541babc7d9a92db4f

build:
  noarch: generic
  number: 1
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-mvtnorm
    - r-survey
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-mvtnorm
    - r-survey

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('ICS')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('ICS')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=ICS
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: "Implementation of Tyler, Critchley, Duembgen and Oja's (JRSS B, 2009, <doi:10.1111/j.1467-9868.2009.00706.x>) and Oja, Sirkia and Eriksson's (AJS, 2006, <http://www.ajs.or.at/index.php/ajs/article/view/vol35,%20no2%263%20-%207>) method of two different scatter matrices to obtain an invariant coordinate system
    or independent components, depending on the underlying assumptions. "
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file: {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - MathiasHaudgaard
    - FrodePedersen
    - ArneKr
